alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 3:49PM CDT until May 17 at 9:41AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Strane Park. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins threatening livestock and property in the river channel. The right approach to the County Road 401 bridge is closed making travel difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 27.3 feet Monday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.3 feet on 10/18/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Navidad River Strane Park 24.0 16.8 Sat 3 pm CDT 25.9 27.2 26.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CDT.
